intro: Uvaria wrayi var. indochinensis, commonly known as the Indochinese starfruit, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish fruits that are edible and have a tangy flavor. Its leaves are typically elliptical and arranged oppositely along the stems. This variety is often found in moist, shaded forest environments.
